question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Struct: Queue] [Table Memory Leak] If oracles are added but never removed, does the existing_oracles table grow unbounded causing state bloat? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: existing_oracles()] [Table Reference Exposure] Does returning &Table<vector<u8>, ExistingOracle> allow read-only access, or could callers exploit internal table structure? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Const: VERSION] [Version Check Missing] VERSION is set to 1 but there's no version validation logic - can old/incompatible code interact with queues? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: version()] [Version Immutability] Queue version is set at creation and never updated - how will queue upgrades handle version migration? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Struct: Queue] [No Migration Path] There's no function to upgrade queue version or migrate data - are queues locked to VERSION=1 forever? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Struct: ExistingOracle] [Oracle Key Storage] oracle_key is stored as vector<u8> - are there any constraints on size or format? Can extremely large keys cause issues? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: queue_key()] [Key Encoding] queue_key returns vector<u8> - is there a standardized encoding format? Can different encodings cause off-chain/on-chain mismatches? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Struct: ExistingOracle] [ID Validation] oracle_id is type ID - is there any validation that this ID corresponds to an actual oracle object on-chain? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: id()] [ID Exposure] Does exposing queue.id.to_inner() allow attackers to predict or manipulate queue IDs? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: fee_types()] [Vector Copy] fee_types() returns a copy of the entire vector - can large fee_types vectors cause excessive gas costs? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: oracle_id()] [Oracle ID Leak] Does exposing oracle.oracle_id allow attackers to directly target oracle objects? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Functions: add_fee_type() & remove_fee_type()] [Race Condition] Can add_fee_type() and remove_fee_type() race when called concurrently for the same type T? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Functions: set_configs() & has_fee_type()] [Config-Fee Type Mismatch] If set_configs() changes queue parameters while has_fee_type() is being checked, can this create inconsistent state? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Functions: set_authority() & has_authority()] [Authority Check Race] If set_authority() changes authority while has_authority() is being evaluated, can the wrong authority be validated? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Functions: add_existing_oracle() & existing_oracles_contains()] [TOCTOU Oracle Check] Can existing_oracles_contains() return false, then add_existing_oracle() adds an oracle, then another transaction fails because oracle already exists? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: set_configs()] [Fee Manipulation Economics] Can authority repeatedly change fee between 0 and high values to extract maximum fees from ongoing operations? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: set_configs()] [Oracle Griefing] Can min_attestations be set to an impossibly high number (e.g., 1000000) making oracle consensus impossible? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Struct: Queue] [Fee Recipient Centralization] Single fee_recipient address creates centralization - can this address be a contract that redistributes fees maliciously? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: set_last_queue_override_ms()] [Millisecond Precision] last_queue_override_ms uses milliseconds - are there overflow risks when comparing with epoch timestamps? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: set_configs()] [Oracle Validity Calculation] When oracle_validity_length_ms is added to a timestamp, can this overflow u64 causing validity checks to fail? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Struct: Queue] [Zero Initialization] last_queue_override_ms starts at 0 - does this create edge cases in override logic where 0 has special meaning? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: has_fee_type()] [Generic Type Confusion] Can has_fee_type<T>() be bypassed by using type aliases or wrapped types that have the same underlying Coin<T>? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: add_fee_type()] [Type Name Collision] If two different packages define Coin<SUI>, can add_fee_type() distinguish between them? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Struct: Queue] [TypeName Storage] Storing TypeName directly in fee_types vector - can this cause issues with type resolution across package upgrades? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/schemas/queue.move] [Function: remove_fee_type()] [Swap Remove Semantics] swap_remove() changes vector order - can this break off-chain indexing that expects stable fee_types ordering? (Low)
